intro: Cephalocarpus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved headfruit, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its elongated leaves and unique fruit structure, which consists of a dense, head-like cluster of small, dry fruits. It typically grows in forested areas and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. The botanical features of Cephalocarpus longifolius make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
